newsitem.title: UK: RESEARCH ALERT - James Capel cuts ICI forecast.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - James Capel cuts ICI forecast.

text.p: HSBC James Capel said on Thursday it cut its full-year profit forecast for ICI after the chemicals group announced its third-quarter results.
"The markets have remained difficult for ICI in the third quarter," David Ingles, analyst at HSBC James Capel said.
Ingles said he cut his full-year forecast by 40 million stg to 640 million. The group earned 951 million stg in 1995.

ICI earlier on Thursday said pre-tax profits dropped to 131 million stg in the third quarter from 248 million a year earlier. Analysts had forecast pre-tax profits between 127 million stg and 140 million stg.
ICI shares have fallen steadily in the last few weeks on a string of downgrades triggered by worries about price pressures in polyester and titanium dioxide markets.
But the stock recouped some recent losses on Thursday, gaining 20-1/2p to 796p on hopes for the company's cost-cutting programme and optimism ICI had come through its worst patch.
